msContents.summary: Tax register, recording day by day the collection of money taxes.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank
+ P.Cair. Inv. 57187; P.Iand. VII, 141; P.Mich. Inv. 2830; 3159; 4910

condition.ab: Regularly cut at the left and right hand sides; the papyrus is broken: at the top, in the end of the column's lines and at the bottom. Few spot of salt can be seen. No restoration is needed. (MA)

handDesc.p: Written in a quick but clear cursive. The scribe separated a new entry from the preceding one by underlining the name of the tax payer. (MA)

origin.origPlace: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt
origin.persName: Pasoknopaios, son of Phasis, grandson of Esouris, mother Tanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 199)
Ptolemaios, son of Petheus, grandson of Heras, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 219)
Heras, son of Melanas, grandson of Petheus, mother Tamystha (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 169)
Sarapion, son of Apollonios, grandson of Harpagathes, mother Thermouthis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 225)
Nikephoros the slave of Longinus, son of Isidorus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)
Germanos, slave (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 160)
Onnophris, son of Pnepheros, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 192)
Chairemon, son of Pasoxis, grandson of Pasoxis, mother Tanephremis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 247)

Petsiris the brother (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 211)

Horos, son of Anchorymphis (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 249)
Phanomgeus, son of Phanomgeus, grandson of Phanomgeus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 245)
Chairemon the son, mother Tbelles (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 247)
Athenion, son of Horos, grandson of Pakysis, mother Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 150)
Euhemeros, son of Neilos, grandson of Euhemeros, mother Taeuhemeros (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 164)
Gaios Julius Satornilus (Sarapion son of Maron) (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 159)
Petesouchos, son of Hatres, grandson of Petheus, mother Tapetheus (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 210)
Heraklas, son of Leonides, grandson of Kastor, mother Thaisas (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 166)
Ninis, son of Asklas, grandson of Ninis, mother Tabous (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 191)

Phalos (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 244)
Thaisarion, daughter of Ptolemaios (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 174)
Ptolemais, daughter of Heras (see P.Mich. IV/2, p. 220)

provenance.p: Karanis, Herakleidou meris, Arsinoite nome, province of Egypt

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Heras, son of Melanas, grandson of Petheus, mother Tamystha, 4 bronze drachmas, the remaining the administrator fee;;Sarapion, son of Apollonios, grandson of Harpagathes, mother Thermouthis, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;Nikephoros the slave of Longinus, son of Isidorus, the administrator fee 4 drachmas;;Germanos slave of the same (person);;Onnophris, son of the administrator fee;;Kastor, son of Marres, grandson of Heras, mother Soeris, the administrator fee 8 drachmas;;The total for the day 196 drachmas, 14 obols;;The 10th of the same (month);;Horos, son of Anchorymphis cultivator, of the 91st cleruchy;;{in the left margin: 12 drachmas, 8 obols} for conveyance of the sheaves for the 13th year of the dirty property of Maikenatiane, 12 drachmas, 3 obols;;Phanomgeus, son of Phanomgeus, grandson of Phanomgeus, mother Taptosiris, the remaining the administrator fee of the priests;;Chairemon the son, mother Tbelles, the remaining the administrator
